attributes.additional_details: I entered a mini roundabout after checking it was clear from the left and right. I then entered the roundabout to make a right turn, after being fully established on the roundabout a driver from my right who was not looking entered after me, he was speeding and did not go around the roundabout like he was suppose to. Instead he drove straight across without looking and hit my car at about 30-35mph. My Insurers have placed blame on to me and I do not see how this can be right.
attributes.background:
Drivers premiums should not be affected if the other driver caused the collision.

Drivers premiums should not be affected if another driver disregards the Highway Code through acts of carelessness.

Insurers should payback 10% of money to drivers if they do not claim for the year.
